page.title: 08The Tower Repairs.
page.content: In 1887 St. Peter's Church tower was found to be leaning some 30 inches towards the south east, because of the danger the tower had to be rebuilt. It was carefully taken down, stone by stone, each one being marked so that it could be replaced exactly. The reconstruction took over five years. There are eight bells in the tower which chime every quarter hour. The tower can still be climbed by the narrow spiral stone staircase. When you go up the tower you can see for miles, you can see six church spires which are: Ringstead, Stanwick, Higham Ferrers, Irchester, Rushden and Raunds. On the top of the tower there is a weather-vane. Sometimes there is a fete at the church when it is possible to climb the tower. It is a good vantage point for taking views of the surrounding countryside.
